items.title: What is Economics?

visible_instructors.job_title: Economics and History teacher, Life Coach and World Citizen!
visible_instructors.title: Mohamed Elashiry
visible_instructors.name: Mohamed

items.headline: For any curious student or adult!
objectives_summary: Learn the basic foundations of economics as a science.

items.title: The key metric of pricing in Economics: Elasticity

visible_instructors.job_title: Head of Business Management, Entrepreneur, TEDx Speaker
visible_instructors.title: Evrim Kanbur
visible_instructors.name: Evrim

items.headline: Economics-The complete course on Elasticity and its business aspect
objectives_summary: Having a deeper understanding of elasticity,  one of the key metrics of pricing
Quantitative analysis and qualitative factors that influence price elasticity
Business aspect of price elasticity considering pricing decisions, total revenue, cost and tax incidence

items.title: (August 2021) Economic Analysis of  “Sales” (Oxford Diploma)
items.headline: Buy one get 5 million free.....? But does that make it right? (Workbook included)
objectives_summary: Black Friday - who gains?
Black Friday - who loses?
Types of pricing policy

items.title: Capitalism in Crisis: The global economic crisis explained
items.headline: The global economy is teetering of the verge of collapsing into a new great depression. Learn why and what's next.
objectives_summary: To give the student a rock solid understanding of the greatest challenge confronting the world today.
To provide a framework through which the student will be able to interpret developments as this crisis continues to unfold.

To enhance the student's ability to respond to this crisis, first as a member of a democratic society that must decide how to respond to this crisis, and second as an individual who must manage his or her financial affairs.

items.title: How The Economy Really Works
items.headline: Understand how the government manages the economy through credit creation & asset price manipulation in the 21st Century
objectives_summary: By the end of the course, you will understand how the economy works in the 21st Century. You will see how and why the government directs the economy; and you will be better positioned to anticipate what the government will do next and to understand how that action will impact asset prices.

items.title: Case Studies in Macro Economics

visible_instructors.job_title: An ex-Google, Stanford and Flipkart team
visible_instructors.title: Loony Corn
visible_instructors.name: Loony

items.headline: A tour of historic economic events decoding them to understand core concepts in Macro-Economics
objectives_summary: Over 21 lectures and 4 hours of content!
Understand what can lead to inflation and when the markets could be cheerful
Know when Central Bank may raise interest rates and when is the right time to invest

items.title: Principles of Macroeconomics
items.headline: Understanding the Fundamental Issues of Macroeconomics
objectives_summary: Describe how inflation, unemployment and GDP are used to measure macroeconomic performance.
Describe how unemployment is used to measure macroeconomic performance.
Describe GDP is used to measure macroeconomic performance.

items.title: The Economic Way of Thinking

visible_instructors.job_title: Lecturer in Economics at University of Notre Dame Australia
visible_instructors.title: Mark Hornshaw
visible_instructors.name: Mark

items.headline: A university/college level course in economics
objectives_summary: Understand the economic way of thinking
Progress to higher level study of economics
Understand concepts such as marginal benefits and costs, and how markets and government work

items.title: Economic principles - learn by watching football!
items.headline: 5 countries: 5 economies: 2 competitions (Includes Economics English course)
objectives_summary: Feel a sense of intellectualism whenever they participate in a discussion about football!
Be able to argue for/against wanting to host the World Cup
See the 2018 World Cup in a whole new (economics) light!

items.title: Introduction to Microeconomics
items.headline: Learn Economics and get some help for your exams
objectives_summary: University level introduction to microeconomics

items.title: Real World Macro Economics (incl)  Trumponomics v Bidenomics
items.headline: Oxford Diploma in : 2021: Macroeconomics in the World Today
objectives_summary: Economic battleground: Trump v Biden
Current economic situation of the USA (Late October 2020)
National Debt - is it a problem

items.title: Of Markets & Men:A Visual Introduction to Austrian Economics
items.headline: The study of real choices made by real people as the only way to make economic sense of the world in which we live.
objectives_summary: Understand human behavior as it relates to economics
Apply understanding to your own life
Enjoy and understand economics more than you ever expected

items.title: Economics:   Competition, Elasticity, a little Game Theory

visible_instructors.job_title: An ex-Google, Stanford and Flipkart team
visible_instructors.title: Loony Corn
visible_instructors.name: Loony

items.headline: Microeconomics is packed with applications to our everyday life - this course will help you connect the dots
objectives_summary: Apply Game Theory to decide whether to be adversarial or co-operative in real-life situations
Determine how best to price products or services that you are selling
Decide the kind of cost structure a firm or enterprise should have, relative to its competitive landscape

items.title: Oxford Diploma : Economics for the Thoughtful Student
items.headline: An unusual approach to learning Economics
objectives_summary: A sense of pride that merely by enrolling they have helped dogs
A greater understanding of Economics (as taught by dogs)
Be aware of surprising parallels between 'Trumponomics' and 'Dogonomics'

items.title: Macroeconomics: A Comprehensive Economics Course
items.headline: A Course Designed to Give You a Better Understanding of the World Around You--Perfect for University and Adult Learners!
objectives_summary: A love of Economics that I hope is contagious!
This Course is an Ideal Companion to any Introductory Economics Class in the World!
A thorough understanding of the main principles of Macroeconomics

items.title: Complexity Economics An Introduction
items.headline: Understanding our global economy as a complex system
objectives_summary: The aim of this course is to give you a solid grasp of the core concepts within the domain of complexity economics
By the end of the course you should be familiar with and be able to apply the most important models from complexity economics
